articles.title: Chinese VP Meets KPA Political Officers Delegation
articles.content:
Chinese VP Meets KPA Political Officers Delegation 
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Xi Jinping, vice-president of the People's Republic of China and member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, met and had a talk with the delegation of political officers of the Korean People's Army led by Kim Jong Gak, first vice-director of the KPA General Political Bureau, at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on Nov. 17.
					 The vice-president said that the KPA delegation's visit to China would contribute to boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the armies of the two countries.
					
					 The two countries have steadily developed the bilateral friendship while maintaining close relations of cooperation in the protracted revolutionary struggle and socialist construction, he said, adding that the Chinese party and government attach great importance to the friendly relations between the two armies and peoples.
					
					 He noted that the armies of the two countries have made great contributions to boosting Sino-DPRK ties of friendship while closely supporting and cooperating with each other.
					
					The army and people of the DPRK have registered big successes in building a great prosperous and powerful nation under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, he said, hoping that the Korean people would make greater progress in the future.

articles.title: Union of Agricultural Workers Plant Trees
articles.content:
Union of Agricultural Workers Plant Trees 
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Officials and members of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea from different parts of the country planted trees in the Arboretum of the Kumsusan Memorial Palace and the Mangyongdae Revolutionary Site on Wednesday.
					 Officials and members of the Central Committee of the union and those from Pyongyang and Pakchon County and various other counties planted more than 4,800 trees of 19 species and over 40,000 flower roots of seven species in the Arboretum of the palace.
					
					 Those from Kaesong City and Suan County and various other counties planted more than 1,200 trees of seven good species in the revolutionary site.

articles.title: Brisk Autumn Land Management Campaign
articles.content:
Brisk Autumn Land Management Campaign
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The autumn land management campaign is in full swing in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The campaign includes projects of building and repairing roads, improving rivers and streams, anti-land-sliding project and the work for covering the whole country with thick woods and greenery by collecting seeds of trees of good species and economic value and increasing sapling production.
					
					 Those in Pyongyang have arranged ditches and roads, planted good species of many trees and spruced the surrounding environment of the Kumsusan Memorial Palace, the sacred temple of Juche, in particular.
					
					Junghwa County dug waterway extending tens of kilometers by removing 48,000 cubic metres of earth so as to irrigate hundreds of hectares of paddies.
					
					 North Phyongan Province is pushing ahead with the project for the overall repair of the Pyongyang-Hyangsan Tourist Motorway, road construction of various cities and county towns and reservoir embankment projects.
					
					 Colorful projects are being undertaken in Kangwon Province. It builds a mother nursery and repairs and manages roads in a regular way.
					
					 Especially Sepho, Anbyon, Ichon and other counties of the province improved the technical conditions of roads through intensive projects of widening roads and retaining walls in some sections of roads.
					
					 River and tide embankment projects are being carried on on a big scale in cities and counties of North and South Hamgyong provinces and North and South Hwanghae provinces.
					
					 The people in Ryanggang and Jagang provinces located in the northern highlands have wound up the work of collecting seeds of trees of good species and planting trees for forestation.

articles.title: Genuine Patriots, Paragons of Songun Era
articles.content:
Genuine Patriots, Paragons of Songun Era
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- True patriots, the pacemakers of the times are growing in number year after year nay, century after century in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 President Kim Il Sung brought up many people as the models of the times in the days of building a new country after the liberation, the Fatherland Liberation War against U.S. imperialism and the grand Chollima march after the war.
					
					 The army and people of Korea have made brilliant victory and proud successes in the struggle for protecting socialism and in the building of a rich and powerful country under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea. All these successes are associated with strenuous efforts made by the people of merit who are devoting themselves for the Party and the leader, the country and the people in the Songun era.
					
					 Work-team head Ri Ho Chol of the Taehung Youth Hero Mine made a great contribution to making the refractory industry of the country Juche-oriented at the end of trial production numbering 149.
					
					 Ju Pok Sun, director of the Manpho Spinning Mill, though she was busy with factory affairs, reared many orphans with maternal affection as pillars of the mill.
					
					 Among the persons of merit in the Songun era are Jo Yong Hwan, a work-team head of the Songjong Co-op Farm in Pongchon County, who is devotedly working on the cooperative fields; Ri Kil Son, a tunneling worker of pit No. 10 under the Jenam Coal Mine, who is registering big successes at the underground cutting face, an important post for building a prosperous country; Ri Un Hui, a merited nurse of the Kaesong City People's Hospital, who has nursed many patients with might and main so that they can work on the socialist construction site; merited teacher Ri Yong Chol, principal of Kim Jong Suk Secondary School No. 1, who trains students as pillars of the great, prosperous and powerful nation with a determination to prop up the country throughout his life; and Kim Phyong Gil, director of the Cableway Management Office for Revolutionary Battle Site on Mt. Paektu, who is obediently devoting his all for the visitors to the sacred land of revolution.
					
					 Jang Tu Il, a designer of the designing office under the Chollima Steel Complex, exerted his all wisdom and energy to the work for establishing a modern steel production process by Korean-style UHP electric arc furnace. And Paek Nam Chol of the Moranbong Bus Company is faithful to his duties to ensure passenger transport for the Pyongyang citizens with the spirit of devoted service to the people.
					
					 Today the meritorious persons of the Songun era with a noble revolutionary character are creating miracles and innovations in the construction of a thriving socialist nation as the paragons of the times under the guidance of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Settle Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Settle Its Past Crimes
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday carries a signed article 104 years since the brigandish fabrication of the "Ulsa (1905) Five-Point Treaty" by the Japanese imperialists. 
					 The article says:
					
					 In order to establish colonial domination over Korea the Japanese imperialists fabricated the above-said treaty, a document with no legal validity, by threatening and blackmailing the Emperor and ministers of the Royal Government of Korea in 1905. This was nothing but an illegal, invalid and fraudulent document as it lacked the approval and signature of Emperor Kojong, the supreme ruler of Korea at that time, and the state seal.
					
					 The colonial rule enforced by the Japanese imperialists over Korea after the fabrication of the treaty was the most hideous crime against humanity as it was the harshest in its brutal and heinous nature and the thrice-cursed and most horrible state-sponsored crime. 
					
					 Japan should be forced to pay for the crimes committed against the Korean people in the past without fail as they can neither be covered up nor written off.
					
					 Japan is under a legal and moral obligation to make an honest apology to all Koreans and pay reparation for its aggression and crimes against humanity.
					
					 A century has passed since the fabrication of the treaty but Japan has not yet reflected on the above-said monstrous crimes. On the contrary, it is busy justifying its blood-stained history of aggression under the signboard of its "legitimacy" and "legality," not content with distorting it. Moreover, it has become undisguised in its moves to stage a comeback to Korea in a bid to realize its old dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere".
					
					 The ultra-right reactionary forces of Japan would be well advised to behave themselves, drawing a serious lesson from their blood-stained past history, and make an honest apology and proper reparation for the crimes committed against Korea in the past.

articles.title: Japan Termed Morally Base
articles.content:
Japan Termed Morally Base
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The Japanese government was recently reported to have decided to grant what it called "special benefit" to ex-soldiers of the Imperial Japanese Army who had been detained in foreign countries during World War II.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 What matters is the wrong attitude of the Japanese government toward the past history. The present approach of the Japanese government towards the past crimes is very prejudiced, narrow-minded and wicked.
					
					 Citing facts to prove that many Asian countries including Korea and China suffered huge mental and material damage due to Japan's policy of national chauvinism during World War II, the commentary urges Japan to settle its crimes perpetrated against those countries in the past before paying compensation to its soldiers.
					
					 Without redeeming those crimes Japan can neither improve its tarnished international image nor regain its moral confidence lost long ago nor exercise any influence in the international community, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 Unaware of the order of priority, Japan is wasting time and energy in utter disregard of the sufferings it imposed upon others. This wrong attitude of Japan is only provoking the derision of all people. 
					
					 Japan is busy playing a tacit trick to shun the redemption of its past crimes, without fulfilling what it should do. This would only bring Japan to self-destruction.
					
					 Japan should not turn its face away from the trend of the present times when a number of countries are settling their inglorious past and turning over a new leaf, looking far into the future.
					
					 Japan would be well advised to clearly understand that its settlement of the past is not a simple deal but a serious political matter on which hinges its fate.

articles.title: Dismantlement of Concrete Wall Demanded
articles.content:
Dismantlement of Concrete Wall Demanded
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea issued a statement on Nov. 10 in demand of the dismantling of the concrete wall.
					 Noting that the Korean nation had been under the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists for more than four decades in the last century and has suffered the tragedy of national division caused by foreign forces for more than half a century after the end of World War II, the statement went on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities have kept even the concrete wall along the Military Demarcation Line, dividing the Korean Peninsula into two parts but the Western media are totally silent about it. 
					
					 The Korean people have a legitimate right to achieve the reunification of the country and the U.S. and other countries responsible for the division of the peninsula should be held accountable for this.
					
					 The concrete wall should be pulled down without fail and the Korean people should achieve the reunification of the country independently and peacefully.

articles.title: President Kim Il Sung Praised in Ethiopia
articles.content:
President Kim Il Sung Praised in Ethiopia
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea released the third issue of its bulletin under the title of "The great man who is praised forever".
					Elaborating on the fact that for his undying feats for the human cause of independence President 
						Kim Il Sung has been presented with gifts, orders, medals, prizes, honorary titles, silk banners and congratulatory messages, etc. from many countries, international organizations and units and personages till now though 15 years have passed since his demise, the bulletin said:
					
					 Presenting glass handicraft "Sun" as a gift, the Switzerland-Korea Committee praised Kim Il Sung as the great sun who founded the immortal Juche idea and led to victory the human cause of independence.
					
					 There were a large number of great persons in the human history but the world knows no such great man as Kim Il Sung who has received gifts, orders, medals and honorary titles from many countries through centuries even after his demise.

articles.title: Unparalleled Bravery
articles.content:
Unparalleled Bravery
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- An anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk took part in a battle for defending the Chechangzi guerrilla zone on a day of October Juche 24 (1935) for the first time after her joining the Korean People's Revolutionary Army. In the battle, she displayed unparalleled bravery and boldness.
					 The Japanese imperialists hurled armed force more than 10,000 strong in the battle in an attempt to wipe out the guerrilla zone and the enemy's bombers indiscriminately pounded the zone without letup. The battle was too fierce for the guerrillas to transport ammunition and bombs from the back side of the height.
					
					 She, with an insight into the battle situation, went to the back side of the height along with several guerrillas, where she rushed toward the position, carrying two ammunition boxes on her back.
					
					 At the very moment a bomb blew up with a terrific explosion in front of them. 
					
					 After a while the guerrillas came to senses and looked around. But she was not seen there.
					
					 She already reached the ridge of the height and called them there.
					
					 Then the guerrillas were greatly struck with admiration at the matchless bravery of her who unhesitatingly rushed toward the combat position through the bomb explosion.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun insiste en ajustar la cuenta de los crimenes de Japon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun insiste en ajustar la cuenta de los crimenes de Japon
Pyongyang, 18 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 104o aniversario de la invencion del leonino "Tratado de 5 puntos de Ulsa" por el imperialismo japones, el diario Rodong Sinmun publico en su edicion de hoy un articulo individual.
					Para implantar el coloniaje sobre Corea, el imperialismo japones invento en 1905 ese documento fraudulento e irracional en sentido juridico amenazando y chantajeando al emperador y ministros de Corea, senala el articulo y prosigue:
					
					  Pero, este tratado resulto ilegal e invalido porque el entonces soberano de Corea, emperador Kojong, no lo habia aprobado, ni firmado y ni sellado.
					
					El colonialismo japones sobre Corea, producto de la invencion de ese tratado, fue tan barbaro y cruel que se ha registrado como inaudito delito anti-etico e imperdonable crimen de Estado de dimension supergrande.
					
					Los crimenes perpetrados en el pasado por Japon contra el pueblo coreano no pueden ser ocultados ni borrados sino han de ser liquidados sin falta.
					
					Japon tiene la responsabilidad legal y moral de pedir disculpas sinceramente e indemnizar a toda la nacion coreana por sus actos agresivos y crimenes anti-eticos.
					
					Pero, hasta hoy a mas de un siglo desde la invencion del "Tratado de 5 puntos de Ulsa", Japon no se arrepiente ni un comino de esos horrendos crimenes. Al contrario, tergiversa su historia de agresiones y la justifica calificandola de "legitima" y "conveniente a la ley".
					
					Para colmo, emprende abiertamente el camino de reagresion a Corea para realizar su antiguo sueno de la "Esfera de coprosperidad de la gran Asia oriental".
					
					Las fuerzas reaccionarias ultraderechistas de Japon deben actuar con prudencia sacando la seria leccion de su historia del pasado manchada de sangre. Y deben pedir disculpas sinceramente por sus crimenes perpetrados en el pasado en Corea e indemnizarlos debidamente.

articles.title: Minju Joson se burla de la bajeza moral de Japon
articles.content:
Minju Joson se burla de la bajeza moral de Japon
Pyongyang, 18 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Hace poco, el gobierno japones decidio pagar con urgencia los llamados "fondos especiales de distribucion" a los ex soldados del viejo ejercito japones que habian sido detenidos en el extranjero durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial. 
					El problema esta en la erronea postura del gobierno japones en cuanto a la historia del pasado. 
					
					Adelanta el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido en su edicion de este miercoles y continua:
					
					Es tan prejuiciado, apocado y travieso el comportamiento actual del gobierno japones relativo a los crimenes del pasado. 
					
					  Durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial, muchos paises asiaticos como Corea y China sufrieron enormes danos espirituales y materiales debido a la politica chovinista a otras naciones de Japon. 
					
					Por lo tanto, es debido que Japon liquide los crimenes cometidos contra esos paises antes de recompensar a sus ex soldados. 
					
					Sin hacerlo, Japon no podra mejorar su imagen manchada en la arena internacional ni recuperar su credito moral que se ha echado por la tierra ni ser influyente en la sociedad internacional.
					
					Todo el mundo se burla de la actitud incorrecta de Japon que esta gastando el tiempo y los esfuerzos en las cosas absurdas sin pensar en las penalidades impuestas a otros ni distinguir cual es el asunto que debe tratar primero.
					
					Esta conducta ajena al deber de Japon no tendra otro resultado que arruinar su propio destino.
					
					Este pais isleno no debe dar espaldas a la corriente de la epoca actual en que los otros del mundo comienzan de nuevo previendo el futuro y liquidando su pasado ignominioso.
					
					Valdra la pena a Japon darse cuenta de que la liquidacion del pasado criminal no es un simple negocio de entrega y recibo de una suma insignificante sino un serio problema politico, de que depende la forja del destino del pais.

articles.title: CIERECO demanda desmantelar la muralla de hormigon armado en Corea
articles.content:
CIERECO demanda desmantelar la muralla de hormigon armado en Corea
 Pyongyang, 18 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El Comite Internacional de Enlace por la Reunificacion y la Paz en Corea (CIERECO) publico el dia 10 una declaracion demandando el desmantelamiento de la muralla de hormigon armado.
					  El documento indica que la nacion coreana se vio obligada a vivir como colonia del imperialismo japones durante mas de 40 anos del siglo pasado y despues de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, viene sufriendo durante mas de medio siglo la tragedia de la division nacional impuesta por las fuerzas extranjeras.
					
					  Condena que aunque las autoridades surcoreanas construyeron en la linea de demarcacion militar esa muralla divisoria que atraviesa el medio de la Peninsula Coreana, los medios de prensa occidental se mantienen callados de ella.
					
					  Subraya que el pueblo coreano tiene el derecho a lograr la reunificacion del pais y es debido que Estados Unidos y otros paises relacionados con la division de la Peninsula Coreana se sientan responsables por el respecto.
					
					  Esta muralla debe ser derrumbada sin falta y el pueblo coreano ha de reunificar el pais de manera independiente y por via pacifica, concluye la nota.

articles.title: Editado boletin en Etiopia
articles.content:
Editado boletin en Etiopia
Pyongyang, 18 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El Comite de Jovenes Etiopes para el Estudio de la Idea Juche dio a luz el boletin No. 3 intitulado "Gran hombre  elogiado eternamente".
					El boletin dio a conocer que gracias a sus hazanas imborrables acumuladas ante la causa de la independencia de la humanidad el Presidente       Kim Il Sung recibe tambien hoy a 15 anos de su fallecimiento los presentes, condecoraciones, medallas, premios, titulos honorificos, banderas y mensajes de felicitacion, etc. por parte de numerosos paises, organizaciones internacionales, unidades y personalidades individuales y continuo:
					
					El Comite Suiza-Corea, al regalar al Presidente el articulo artesanal de vidrio "El sol", elogio que el es el gran Sol quien creo la inmortal idea Juche y condujo a la victoria la causa de la independencia de la humanidad.
					
					No son pocos los grandes hombres en la historia de la humanidad, pero, tanto en el Oriente y el Occidente como en la antiguedad y la actualidad, no hay tal gran hombre como Presidente Kim Il Sung quien sigue recibiendo los regalos, ordenes, medallas y titulos honorificos de numerosos  paises de siglo en siglo aun despues del fallecimiento.
